item.title: Address Poisoning Losses Surged 13x After Ethereum's Fusaka Upgrade
item.description: Fusaka reduced gas fees 6x, helping attackers increase address poisoning volume 5.6x. In 73 days after the upgrade, victims lost $63.3M â€” a 13-fold increase compared to the same period before Fusaka ($4.9M).

item.title: Curators of TheDAO's $220M Set a Precedent for Using Owners' Funds for Their Own Ends
item.description: Seven curators including Vitalik Buterin took control of $220M in unclaimed TheDAO funds to stake and fund Ethereum security grants. Two original curators resigned in protest, citing violation of fiduciary duties and legal risks.

item.title: Will TheDAO's $220M Security Fund Actually Make Ethereum Safer?
item.description: The TheDAO Security Fund sets a dangerous precedent for property rights in crypto. Meanwhile, Ethereum's security problems are too fundamental to solve by throwing money at them.

item.title: Record-High Activity in Ethereum Network Caused by Address Poisoning Attacks
item.description: Over $740K already stolen through address poisoning attacks enabled by the Fusaka upgrade which reduced transaction fees 6-fold. The attack is ongoing with millions of addresses receiving poisoning dust.
